sentence: Technology stocks were declining this afternoon, with shares of tech companies in the S&P 500 posting a 0.9% retreat.

In company news, Cheetah Mobile ( CMCM ) tumbled to a record low on Thursday after the Chinese performance software-maker for mobile devices and personal computers offered up a weak revenue outlook for the current quarter, upstaging above-consensus Q1 results.

The company is projecting revenue for the three months ending late next month in a range of RMB 975 million to RMB 1.0 billion, trailing the consensus view looking for around RMB 1.39 billion in Q2 revenue.

For the just-completed Q1, Cheetah earned RMB 0.71 per share, excluding one-time items, improving on adjusted net income of RMB 0.54 per share during the year-ago period and beating the Capital IQ consensus by RMB 0.04 per share.
Revenue rose 57.2% over the same quarter last year to RMB 1.12 billion and squeaking past the RMB 1.09 billion Street view.
CMCM American depository shares were down almost 20% at $11.27 apiece, earlier sinking to an all-time low of $11.08 a share.
(+) CRM, (+4.0%) Adjusted Q1 EPS of $0.24 tops Capital IQ consensus by $0.01 per share.
Revenue climbs 28% from last year to $1.92 bln, also beating the $1.89 bln consensus.
(-) CDRB, (-19.1%) Files for Chapter 7 bankruptcy liquidation.
Terminates proposed merger with Aegis Identity Software.
All board members and executive officers, including CEO Arben Kryeziu, resign.
